Fire Recovery Assistance.description: Start here if you’ve been directly impacted. These resources offer direct support for housing, aid, and recovery services.

items.title: California Wildfire Recovery Portal
items.description: Official state hub for recovery info, aid, and contacts.

items.title: LA County Household Relief Grant
items.description: One-time cash grants ($6K–$18K) for households hardest-hit by the fires.

items.title: Disaster Assistance Application Portal
items.description: Apply for federal disaster assistance online.

items.title: 211 LA / Airbnb.org Emergency Housing
items.description: Emergency shelter coordinated through Airbnb and local partnerships.

Rebuilding & Permits.description: From permits to defensible space, these guides help you take the first steps toward rebuilding.

items.title: California Building Officials – Wildfire Recovery Hub
items.description: Stay informed on current wildfire activity and recovery efforts.

items.title: CAL FIRE Rebuild Guide
items.description: Steps for safe rebuilding and defensible space compliance.

Mental Health Support.description: Emotional recovery is just as important. These services can help you and your loved ones navigate grief, trauma, and stress.

items.title: CalHOPE Support Line
items.description: Free emotional support for Californians affected by disaster.

items.title: NAMI California
items.description: Peer support and resources for mental health recovery.

items.title: Disaster Distress Helpline
items.description: 24/7 confidential support for people experiencing emotional distress due to disasters.

items.title: L.A. County Department of Mental Health – Disaster Services
items.description: Provides emergency psychiatric intervention and clinical services to persons in crisis.

Legal & Financial Aid.description: Understand your rights and options. These links connect you with legal and financial help for wildfire recovery.

items.title: Insurance Assistance – CA Dept of Insurance
items.description: Resources for dealing with wildfire-related insurance claims.

items.title: State Bar of California – Legal Help After a Disaster
items.description: Statewide legal assistance hotline for disaster victims.

items.title: Disaster Legal Services California
items.description: Free legal help for survivors of California disasters.

Emergency Preparedness.description: Planning ahead can save lives. These tools help you prepare for future wildfires and stay informed during emergencies.

items.title: Ready for Wildfire (CAL FIRE)
items.description: Tips and tools to prepare for wildfires, including evacuation plans and defensible space.

items.title: Listos California – Resource Hub
items.description: Free materials in many languages to promote disaster preparedness.

Community & Volunteer Opportunities.description: Get involved or find help in your local area. These organizations support communities during and after wildfires.

items.title: California Volunteers – Wildfire Recovery
items.description: Opportunities to volunteer and support communities impacted by wildfires.

items.title: California Fire Foundation – Disaster Relief
items.description: Supports survivors, firefighters, and communities affected by natural disasters.

Animal & Pet Services.description: Find lost pets, get shelter or supplies, and access veterinary care for animals affected by the fire.

items.title: LA Animal Services – Emergency Evacuation Hotline
items.description: Support for locating or sheltering pets affected by wildfires.

items.title: Petco Love Lost
items.description: Facial recognition-powered platform to help reunite lost pets with their owners.

Utility Relief & Restoration.description: Support from local utility companies and agencies to help restore and afford essential services after a fire.

items.title: LADWP – Emergency Assistance
items.description: Los Angeles Department of Water & Power wildfire relief support.

items.title: Southern California Edison – Disaster Relief Program
items.description: Bill relief, late fee waivers, and reconnection assistance for wildfire-affected customers.

items.title: California Public Utilities Commission – Wildfire Protections
items.description: Consumer protections during wildfire emergencies including shutoff suspensions and fee waivers.

Food & Basic Needs.description: Organizations providing food, hygiene kits, and daily necessities to fire-impacted residents.

items.title: Los Angeles Regional Food Bank
items.description: Emergency food distribution for individuals and families affected by wildfires.

items.title: 211 LA County – Food & Shelter
items.description: Find open food pantries, meal programs, and temporary housing.

Cleanup & Environmental Safety.description: Protect yourself and your property during recovery. This section covers debris removal programs, air and water quality, and safety guidance.

items.title: LA County Public Works Debris Removal Program
items.description: Free two-phase cleanup of hazardous waste and fire debris for eligible homeowners.

items.title: California Wildfire Cleanup Program
items.description: Statewide wildfire debris removal information and sign-up portal.

items.title: Post-Fire Debris Flow Information – LA County
items.description: Post-wildfire mudslide, erosion, and debris flow safety guidance.

items.title: AirNow – Wildfire Smoke Tracker
items.description: Real-time air quality map and smoke advisories.
